Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a large red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.158)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36344) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36344)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 207 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13390 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
